intro: Mila fortalezensis, commonly known as the Brazilian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which serve as a natural defense mechanism against herbivores. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a rough texture. Mila fortalezensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
